input:
CONVERSATION HISTORY:
[
  "DOCTOR: What brings you in today?",
  "PATIENT: I'm a 72-year-old man, and I suddenly got this really sharp, constant pain in my stomach and back, and I feel dizzy and lightheaded.",
  "DOCTOR: When exactly did these symptoms first begin, and how have they changed or progressed since then?",
  "PATIENT: Well, it kind of just started suddenly today, like, a few hours ago, and it\u2019s been pretty bad ever since. The pain\u2019s been sharp and steady, and it\u2019s radiating down to my groin. I also started feeling dizzy and lightheaded, especially when I try to stand up. It didn\u2019t really come and go; it just stayed the same since it began."
]

CONVERSATION HISTORY:
[
  "DOCTOR: What brings you in today?",
  "PATIENT: I'm a 72-year-old man, and I suddenly got this really sharp, constant pain in my stomach and back, and I feel dizzy and lightheaded.",
  "DOCTOR: When exactly did these symptoms first begin, and how have they changed or progressed since then?",
  "PATIENT: Well, it kind of just started suddenly today, like, a few hours ago, and it\u2019s been pretty bad ever since.   "DOCTOR: Has the pain been constant since it first started, or have you noticed it coming and going? And have anything made it better or worse?",
  "PATIENT: It\u2019s been pretty much the same since it started \u2014 just sharp and constant, like a big ache that won\u2019t go away. input:
CONVERSATION HISTORY:
[
  "DOCTOR: What brings you in today?",
  "PATIENT: I'm a 72-year-old man, and I suddenly got this really sharp, constant pain in my stomach and back, and I feel dizzy and lightheaded.",
  "DOCTOR: When exactly did these symptoms first begin, and how have they changed or progressed since then?",
  "PATIENT: Well, it kind of just started suddenly today, like, a few hours ago, and it\u2019s been pretty bad ever since. The pain\u2019s been sharp and steady, and it\u2019s radiating down to my groin. I also started feeling dizzy and lightheaded, especially when I try to stand up. It didn\u2019t really come and go; it just stayed the same since it began.",
  "DOCTOR: Has the pain been constant since it first started, or have you noticed it coming and going? And have anything made it better or worse?",
  "PATIENT: It\u2019s been pretty much the same since it started \u2014 just sharp and constant, like a big ache that won\u2019t go away. I don\u2019t think it\u2019s really come and gone; it\u2019s been there all along. Nothing I\u2019ve done seems to make it better or worse, really. It just stays the same, and I started feeling lightheaded and dizzy, so I thought I should come in.",
  "DOCTOR: Have you experienced similar episodes in the past, or is this the first time you've had these symptoms?",
  "PATIENT: No, I don\u2019t think I\u2019ve ever felt anything like this before. It\u2019s been just this sudden, really sharp pain that\u2019s not going away, and I feel dizzy too. I don\u2019t remember having anything like it.",
  "DOCTOR: Do you have any history of regular high blood pressure, known aneurysms, or recent trauma or strenuous activity before these symptoms started?",
  "PATIENT: Well, I've had high blood pressure for a while, but I can't really say I've been told I have any aneurysms. I don\u2019t remember any recent injuries or really strenuous activities before this pain started\u2014nothing that I think could have caused it. I just suddenly felt this sharp pain in my belly and back, and I started feeling dizzy and lightheaded.",
  "DOCTOR: Have you noticed any previous episodes of similar pain or symptoms, even if they were milder, or did this pain come on suddenly without warning?",
  "PATIENT: No, I don\u2019t think I\u2019ve ever had anything like this before. I\u2019ve had some tired feelings before, but not real pain like this, and it just came on all of a sudden."
]
